meanings.definition: To give authority or permission for something to continue or be used again.
meanings.sent1: The principal will reauthorize the student's library privileges.
meanings.sent2: The board decided to reauthorize the construction project for another year.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand reauthorized the pumpkin to turn into a carriage once more.
meanings.sent4: The key reauthorized access to the hidden garden of wonders.
meanings.sent5: The judge's signature reauthorized the search warrant, allowing the police to continue their investigation.

meanings.definition: To grant new authority or permission for something.
meanings.sent1: The committee will reauthorize the budget allocation for the upcoming fiscal year.
meanings.sent2: Congress must reauthorize the funding for the national parks.
meanings.sent3: The king jokingly reauthorized the court jester to tell more puns at the royal banquet.
meanings.sent4: The queen's decree reauthorized the knight to embark on a daring quest.
meanings.sent5: The CEO's signature reauthorized the marketing team to launch the new product campaign.
